sen.j: 黄檗駅（おうばくえき）は、京都府宇治市にある、京阪電気鉄道・西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located in Uji City of Kyoto Prefecture, Obaku Station is a stop on Keihan Electric Railway and West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Lines.
Obaku Station, located in Uji City of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Electric Railway and West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) lines.
Obaku Station, located in Uji City of Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Keihan Electric Railway and West Japan Railway Company (JR West) lines.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 京阪宇治線
sen.e: Keihan Uji Line
Keihan Uji Line
Keihan Uji Line

sen.j: 西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）
sen.e: West Japan Railway Company (JR-West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR-West)
West Japan Railway Company (JR West)

sen.j: 奈良線
sen.e: Nara Line
Nara Line
Nara Line

sen.j: 両線ともICOCA（西日本旅客鉄道）・PiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）の利用が可能。
sen.e: Both ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) Cards can be used.
Both the ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (Surutto Kansai Association) cards can be used.
The ICOCA (West Japan Railway Company) and PiTaPa (Surutto KANSAI Association) cards can be used on both lines.

sen.j: ただし、JスルーはJR線、スルッとKANSAI対応各種カードは京阪線でのみ使用可能。
sen.e: J Through Cards can only be used on JR Lines and various Kansai Thru Pass compatible cards only on Keihan Line.
J Through cards can only be used on JR Lines and various Kansai Thru Pass-compatible cards only on the Keihan Line.
J-Thru cards can only be used on JR Lines and various KANSAI THRU PASS-compatible cards only on the Keihan Line.

sen.j: 両駅とも隣接しているが、路線自体が競合関係にあるため、連絡通路などの設備は無く、そのような計画も無い。
sen.e: Both stations are situated in close proximity to each other and as routes themselves compete head-to-head, neither connecting passageways nor plans for such exist.
Both stations are situated in close proximity to each other and as routes themselves compete head to head; neither connecting passageways nor plans for such exist.
The stations are situated in close proximity to each other; as routes themselves compete head to head, neither connecting passageways nor plans for such exist.

sen.j: 両駅のホームの端同士は目と鼻の先にあるものの駅舎の出入口は離れており、乗り換えるためにはかなり遠回りをしなくてはならない。
sen.e: Although the ends of their platforms are ladjacent to each other, entrance/exits to respective station buildings are at quite a distance and those transferring are obliged to make a detour.
Although the ends of their platforms are adjacent to each other, entrance/exits to the respective station buildings are at quite a distance and those transferring are obliged to make a detour.
Although the ends of their platforms are adjacent to each other, entrances/exits to the respective station buildings are at quite a distance and those transferring are obliged to make a detour.

sen.j: プラットホーム形状と配置2面2線のプラットホームを持つ地上駅である。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two platforms and double tracks.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms and double tracks.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms and double tracks.

sen.j: 急カーブ上に位置し、「電車とホームの間に注意」というステッカーがホームに貼り付けられている。
sen.e: It is located at a spot which is sharply curved and stickers printed 'Beware of gap between train and platform' are stuck to the surface of platforms.
It is located at a spot that is sharply curved, and labels printed 'Beware of gap between train and platform' are applied to the surfaces of platforms.
It is located at a spot that is sharply curved, and labels printed 'Beware of gap between train and platform' are applied to the surfaces of platforms.

sen.j: 改札口は上下線で別々に設けられており、改札内でホーム同士を行き来することはできない。
sen.e: Ticket gates for inbound and outbound platforms are separated and going back and forth between the two once inside ticket gates is not possible.
Ticket gates for the inbound and outbound platforms are separated, so it isn't possible to go back and forth between the two once inside the ticket gates.
Ticket gates for the inbound and outbound platforms are separated, so it isn't possible to go back and forth between the two once inside the ticket gates.

sen.j: どちらのホームも中書島寄りに改札があり、宇治方面行きホームの改札は無人。
sen.e: Ticket gates of both platforms are located nearer Chushojima and ticket gates installed on the platform for Uji are unmanned.
The ticket gates of both platforms are located nearer Chushojima, and the ticket gates on the platform for Uji are unmanned.
The ticket gates of both platforms are located nearer Chushojima, and the ticket gates on the platform for Uji are unmanned.

sen.j: 中書島方面行きホームの改札には駅員が常駐している。
sen.e: Ｓtaffs are always stationed on the platform for Chushojima.
Ｓtation staff are always stationed on the platform for Chushojima.
Ｓtation staff are always stationed on the platform for Chushojima.

sen.j: 2006年6月30日で売店の営業は終了し、現在では飲料および新聞の自動販売機があるのみとなっている。
sen.e: The Kiosk stall closed down on June 30, 2006 and only automatic vending machines for beverages and newpapers exist as of now.
The Kiosk stall closed down on June 30, 2006, and currently only automatic vending machines for beverages and newpapers exist.
The Kiosk stall closed down on June 30, 2006, and currently only automatic vending machines for beverages and newspapers exist.

sen.j: ※両ホームとも有効長は5両。
sen.e: ※Both platforms have an effective length to accommodate five car trains.
※Each of the platforms has a length sufficient to accommodate a five-car train.
※Each of the platforms has a length sufficient to accommodate a five-car train.

sen.j: のりばの番号表示はない。
sen.e: Track/Platform numbers are not indicated.
Track/platform numbers are not indicated.
Platform numbers are not indicated.

sen.j: 相対式2面2線のホームを持つ、交換設備を備えた地上駅である。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks and at which trains can pass each other or pass others.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks and at which trains can pass each other or pass others.
It is an above-ground station with two platforms opposite each other and double tracks and at which trains can pass each other or pass others.

sen.j: 構内配線が一線スルーになっていないため、快速は減速して通過する。
sen.e: As track configuration does not provide for thoroughfare, rapid trains slow down and pass by without stopping.
Since the track configuration does not provide for thoroughfare, rapid trains slow down and pass by without stopping.
Since the track configuration does not provide for thoroughfare, rapid trains slow down and pass by without stopping.

sen.j: かつては単式1面1線のホームしかなかったが（現在の2番線）、奈良線の輸送力増強のためにホームが新設された（現在の1番線）。
sen.e: There was a time in the past when the station had only one platform (present Track #2 platform,) but another one (present Track #1 platform) was newly installed to enhance Nara Line carrying capacity.

There was a time in the past when the station had only one platform (present track No. 2 platform), but another one (the present track No. 1 platform) was newly installed to enhance the Nara Line's carrying capacity.
There was a time in the past when the station had only one platform (currently Platform 2), but another one (currently Platform 1) was newly installed to enhance the Nara Line's carrying capacity.

sen.j: 非常にこぢんまりとした駅舎を持ち、電車を降りるとすぐに改札という構造になっている。
sen.e: Station building is extremely compact and of a structure when once alighting from cars, ticket gates are located right in front.
Station building is extremely compact and of such a structure that when alighting from cars, the ticket gates are located directly in front.
Station building is extremely compact and of such a structure that when alighting from cars, the ticket gates are located directly in front.

sen.j: なお駅業務は（株）ジェイアール西日本交通サービスへ委託されている。
sen.e: Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.
Station operations are commissioned to JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道 - 1日の乗車人員は約3,441人（京阪電気鉄道調べ）。
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway - Number of passengers getting on at this station is approximately 3,441 per day. (Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. survey)
sen.cmt: "約"でなく"平均"であるべきと思われます。
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway - The number of passengers getting on at this station is approximately 3,441 per day (Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd. survey).
Keihan Electric Railway - The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 3,441 per day (according to a survey by Keihan Electric Railway Co., Ltd.).

sen.j: JR西日本 - 1日の乗車人員は約3,282人（西日本旅客鉄道調べ）。
sen.e: JR-West - Number of passengers getting on at this station is approximately 3,282 per day. (West Japan Railway Company survey)
sen.cmt: "約"でなく"平均"であるべきと思われます。
sen.e: JR West - The number of passengers getting on at this station is approximately 3,282 per day (West Japan Railway Company survey).
JR West - The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 3,282 per day (West Japan Railway Company survey).

sen.j: ともに平成18年度の京都府統計書より。
sen.e: (Source: Both from Fiscal 2006 Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: both from the Fiscal 2006 Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
(Source: both from the Fiscal Year 2006 Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 萬福寺 黄檗宗大本山。
sen.e: Manpuku-ji Temple Obaku-shu Head Temple
Manpuku-ji Temple Obaku-shu Head Temple
Mampuku-ji Temple Obaku-sect Head Temple

sen.j: 許波多神社五ヶ庄の許波多神社
sen.e: Kohata-jinja Shrine Kohata-jinja Shrine of Gokasho
Kohata-jinja Shrine Kohata-jinja Shrine of Gokasho
Kohata-jinja Shrine Kohata-jinja Shrine of Gokasho

sen.j: 京都大学宇治キャンパス
sen.e: Kyoto University Uji Campus
Kyoto University Uji Campus
Kyoto University Uji Campus

sen.j: 京都芸術高等学校
sen.e: Kyoto Art Senior High School
Kyoto Art Senior High School
Kyoto Art Senior High School

sen.j: 宇治市立東宇治中学校
sen.e: Uji Municipal Higashiuji Junior High School
Uji Municipal Higashiuji Junior High School
Uji Municipal Higashiuji Junior High School

sen.j: 宇治五ヶ庄郵便局
sen.e: Uji-Gokasho Post Office
Uji-Gokasho Post Office
Uji-Gokasho Post Office

sen.j: 京都府道7号京都宇治線
sen.e: Kyoto Prefectural Highway Route No.7 Kyoto-Uji Road
Kyoto Prefectural Highway Route No. 7 Kyoto-Uji Road
Kyoto-Uji Line of the Kyoto Prefectural Route 7

sen.j: 1913年（大正2年）6月1日 京阪電鉄宇治線の駅が開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on June 1, 1913 as a station on the Uji Line of Keihan Electric Railway.
sen.cmt: "が"を"として"に読み替えました。
sen.e: It was inaugurated on June 1, 1913 as a station on the Uji Line of Keihan Electric Railway.
June 1, 1913: It was inaugurated as a station on the Uji Line of Keihan Electric Railway.

sen.j: 当時の駅名は黄檗山駅。
sen.e: The then name of the station was Obakusan.
At that time, the station's name was Obakusan.
At that time, the station's name was Obakusan Station.

sen.j: 1926年（大正15年） 黄檗駅に改称。
sen.e: Renamed Obaku Station in 1926.
It was renamed Obaku Station in 1926.
1926: The station was renamed Obaku Station.

sen.j: 1943年（昭和18年）10月1日 会社合併により京阪神急行電鉄（阪急電鉄）の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Keihanshin-kyuko-dentsu (Hankyu Corporation) station on Oct. 1, 1943 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Keihanshin-kyuko-dentsu (Hankyu Corporation) station on Oct. 1, 1943 as a result of amalgamation.
October 1, 1943: It became a Keihanshin-kyuko-dentsu (Hankyu Corporation) station as a result of amalgamation.

sen.j: 1949年（昭和24年）12月1日 会社分離により京阪電気鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Keihan Electric Railway station on Dec. 1, 1949 as a result of corporate severance.
It became a Keihan Electric Railway station on Dec. 1, 1949 as a result of corporate severance.
December 1, 1949: It became a Keihan Electric Railway station as a result of corporate severance.

sen.j: 1961年（昭和36年）4月21日 日本国有鉄道奈良線の駅が開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated as a Japanese National Railways Nara Line station on April 1, 1961.
sen.cmt: "が"を"として"に読み替えました。
sen.e: It was inaugurated as a Japanese National Railways Nara Line station on April 1, 1961.
April 1, 1961: It was inaugurated as a Japan National Railways Nara Line station.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 国鉄分割民営化により、国鉄の駅がJR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Japan National Railways station became a West Japan Railway Company station on April 1, 1987 as a result of split privatization of Japan National Railways.
Japan National Railways station became a West Japan Railway Company station on April 1, 1987 as a result of the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: Japan National Railways station became a West Japan Railway Company station as a result of the split privatization of Japan National Railways.

sen.j: 1999年（平成11年）9月27日 京阪宇治行きホームに車イス対応トイレを設置、使用開始。
sen.e: A wheelchair compatible restroom installed on platform for Keihan Uji and became usable on Sept. 27, 1999.
A wheelchair-compatible restroom was installed on platform for Keihan Uji and became operational on Sept. 27, 1999.
September 27, 1999: A wheelchair-compatible restroom was installed on the platform for Keihan Uji and became operational.

sen.j: 2002年（平成14年）3月11日 京阪宇治行きホームに転落検知マットとホーム異常通報装置が設置される
sen.e: Tumbling off detection mat and platform abnormalcy communication unit installed on the platform for Uji on March 11, 2002.
A tumbling-off detection mat and platform abnormality communication unit were installed on the platform for Uji on March 11, 2002.
March 11, 2002: A tumbling-off detection mat and platform abnormality communication unit were installed on the platform for Keihan Uji.

sen.j: 京阪電気鉄道
sen.e: Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway
Keihan Electric Railway

sen.j: 宇治線（全列車が各駅に停車）
sen.e: Uji Line (all trains stop at each station)
Uji Line (all trains stop at each station)
Uji Line (all trains stop at each station)

sen.e: Kohata Station (JR-West) - Obaku Station - Uji Ｓｔａｔｉｏｎ (JR-West)
